1027019525898682368.text: I'm worried about the "token curated registry" hype. I see a lot of mechanisms that just boil down to "token holders vote", but for well known reasons (eg. see https://vitalik.ca/general/2018/03/28/plutocracy.html … ) there are deep flaws in that model. The specifics of your incentive mechanism matter!

1120759505099399168.text:
4/

The five months since launch have passed at breakneck speed.

I knew Uniswap was special, but did not expect such rapid growth in community support and usage.

No one has to trust me to use it. To me this is a testament to the unstoppable power of open finance and @ethereum.pic.twitter.com/BW5b3e9y89

1120759510665134081.text:
9/

I am often asked for my thoughts on funding for public good projects.

With regards to business model, we are still early in the ideation phase. However, the open and decentralized nature of Uniswap will remain a core value of any project that I lead.

1120759504063348736.text:
3/ 

One year later I launched Uniswap — a decentralized exchange protocol complete with an audit and open-source frontend. 

This would not have been possible w/o the support of @karl_dot_tech @VitalikButerin the @ethereum grants program and many others.https://twitter.com/haydenzadams/status/1058376395108376577 …

1112450778218803200.text: Me being excited about the future of @UniswapExchangepic.twitter.com/7YYSNmGOSO

1117608987854290944.text:

1109215579804717056.text:
At it's best it provides minimal and temporary benefits, while risking a contentious or failed hard fork. I'm against it, for what my signaling is worth.

Also see Phil's article here:
https://pdaian.com/blog/anti-asic-forks-considered-harmful/ …

1120759500938600453.text:
2/ 

Uniswap started as a side project for me. A way to learn the required skills to transition from mechanical engineer to crypto dev.

This is what it looked like in Nov. 2017 when it was my first smart contract, first website, and first major coding project!pic.twitter.com/EUkPV0X7sM

1120759509868253184.text:
8/

This is why I am so excited to have @NoahZinsmeister and @_callil joining as my first two incredible full-time team members.

And why I'm so excited to have the support and guidance of @paradigm — some of the most brilliant people I have had the pleasure of meeting this year.

1120759509130067970.text:
7/

As fun as it's been, I cannot lead, research, develop, market, and fundraise all at once. It's overwhelming and ineffective.

Simply put: my goals go beyond what I can (or want to) accomplish alone.

1114227167292940289.text: Excited to talk about @UniswapExchange at #Fluidity2019 on May 9 in Brooklyn NY!https://twitter.com/airswap/status/1114191475821174784 …

1120759507490099201.text:
5/

I strongly believe an open-source financial system will result in a fairer distribution of wealth and increased participation by those excluded from our current system.

My goal is to move this forward as much as possible, and push it in an inclusive + equitable direction.

1120759508391878659.text:
6/

This was foremost in my mind when I decided to raise money and form a company.

I've had so many incredible contributors and supporters. It's not my intention to diminish this support when I say that through all of this, I've been the only person working on Uniswap full time.

Uniswap is the anti-hype-bubble project

I mostly agree with you :)

Sustainable business models are important. The lack of one in Uniswap (so far ) is not what I want to be the major takeaway. 

Projects should build something that works before raising huge amounts of money. 

Business models shouldn’t add friction.

1078822793175801862.text:
5/ 

I think I'm getting into general complaints not formula specific so I'll end here :)

1078822792265695232.text:
4b/ 

@Bancor pricing could be manipulated if the company was running a frontrunning miner that also controls the $BNT admin private key. They can mint and burn $BNT tokens at will to push rates as desired. 

See lines 349-369 of $BNT contract:
https://etherscan.io/address/0x1f573d6fb3f13d689ff844b4ce37794d79a7ff1c#code …

1078822791393226753.text:
4a/ 

@UniswapExchange formula is the ONLY governance in Uniswap and cannot be manipulated.

It was formalized and partially verified by @rv_inc
https://github.com/runtimeverification/verified-smart-contracts/tree/uniswap/uniswap …

1078822790160138240.text:
2c/

Basically, profit is tied to holding $BNT, not contribution to the system. Convenient when you hold 50% and sell the other 50% for $150,000,000

1078822789442875392.text:
2b/ 

Instead Bancor "fees" are that you are 50% hedged into $BNT, which they claim will increase in value as more markets are created. 

Even if true, this profit could be claimed by HODLing $BNT in a cold wallet... and not risking being a liquidity provider.

1075206440908980224.text:
Also @VitalikButerin's comment at the bottom of this article:

http://hackingdistributed.com/2017/06/19/bancor-is-flawed/ …https://twitter.com/badcryptobitch/status/1075056926826803200 …

1072291675458949120.text: 4/ As a DAPP dev it is not my responsibility to build custom support for every single token - that defeats the purpose of having a standard in the first place.

1072291674804641793.text: 3/ But what you should not do is ignore the problem. You are putting user funds at risk. Reissue the token, create a wrapper contract, or permanently stop calling yourself ERC20.

1072291674112606208.text: 2/ If you expected an ERC20 token but didn't get one - whether due to a dev mistake, hubris (we don't need to follow the standard!), or because the openzeppelin-solidity library messed up their reference implementation for a few months that sucks.
